name: VNVector
desc: An immutable, two-dimensional vector represented by its x-axis and y-axis projections.

items.name: init(byAdding: VNVector, to: VNVector)
items.desc: Creates a new vector by adding the specified vectors.

items.name: init(bySubtracting: VNVector, from: VNVector)
items.desc: Creates a new vector by subtracting the first vector from the second vector.

items.name: init(byMultiplying: VNVector, byScalar: Double)
items.desc: Creates a new vector by multiplying the specified vector’s x-axis and y-axis projections by the scalar value.

items.name: init(r: Double, theta: Double)
items.desc: Creates a new vector in polar coordinate space.

items.name: init(vectorHead: VNPoint, tail: VNPoint)
items.desc: Creates a new vector in Cartesian coordinate space.

items.name: init(xComponent: Double, yComponent: Double)
items.desc: Creates a new vector in Cartesian coordinate space, based on its x-axis and y-axis projections.

items.name: class var zero: VNVector
items.desc: A vector object with zero length.

items.name: var length: Double
items.desc: The length, or absolute value, of the vector.

items.name: var r: Double
items.desc: The radius, absolute value, or length of the vector.

items.name: var theta: Double
items.desc: The angle between the vector direction and the positive direction of the x-axis.

items.name: var squaredLength: Double
items.desc: The squared length of the vector.

items.name: var x: Double
items.desc: A signed projection that indicates the vector’s direction on the x-axis.

items.name: var y: Double
items.desc: A signed projection that indicates the vector’s direction on the y-axis.

items.name: class func dotProduct(of: VNVector, vector: VNVector) -> Double
items.desc: Caclulates the dot product of two vectors.

items.name: class func unitVector(for: VNVector) -> VNVector
items.desc: Calculates a vector that’s normalized by preserving its direction, so that the vector length equals 1.0.
